question: Which country houses the "Paga Crocodile Pond"?
explanation: Paga Crocodile Pond is an IUCN category IV habitat/species management area and a sacred pond in Paga in the Upper East Region of Ghana, which is inhabited by West African crocodiles. Due to the friendliness of the reptiles, it has become popular among tourists and the pond is now reliant on tourism to ensure the population of crocodiles remain fed and healthy. It is also known as Chief's pond.
